Package jhd.AddIns

Class GenericDialogAddin.RadioButtonField

java.lang.Object
jhd.AddIns.GenericDialogAddin.RadioButtonField
Enclosing class:
GenericDialogAddin
public class GenericDialogAddin.RadioButtonField
extends java.lang.Object
A class containing the Object(s) created by GenericDialog.addRadioButtonGroup
and convenient access methods
Author:
LazzyIzzi

  • Method Details

    • addRadioButton

      public void addRadioButton​(java.lang.String item)
      Adds a single RadioButton to the existing group
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be added

    • addRadioButtons

      public void addRadioButtons​(java.lang.String[] items, int rows, int columns)
      Adds RadioButtons to the existing group
      Parameters:
      items - the items to be added
      rows - the rows in the new radioButton display, 0 to auto fit
      columns - the columns in the new radioButton display

    • getCheckboxGroup

      public java.awt.CheckboxGroup getCheckboxGroup()
      Returns:
      the checkboxGroup for the radioButtons

    • getLabel

      public java.awt.Label getLabel()
      Returns:
      gets the RadioButtonGroup's Label Object

    • getRadioButtons

      public java.awt.Checkbox[] getRadioButtons()
      Returns:
      the radio button Checkboxes

    • getSelectedItem

      public java.lang.String getSelectedItem()
      Returns:
      the text label of the selected radio button

    • getPanel

      public java.awt.Panel getPanel()
      Returns:
      the Panel containing the RadioButtonGroup

    • setLabel

      public void setLabel​(java.lang.String labelText)
      Deprecated.
      use getLabel().setText();
      Sets the Checkbox's Label
      Parameters:
      labelText - the new label text

    • setRadioButtons

      public void setRadioButtons​(java.lang.String[] items, int rows, int columns)
      Replaces the RadioButtons with new items
      Parameters:
      items - the replacement radio button label strings
      rows - the rows in the new radioButton display, 0 to auto fit
      columns - the columns in the new radioButton display
